title: Why does aluminium foil spark in a microwave but not in an oven
description: Ever wondered why aluminium foil sparks in microwaves but not conventional ovens?  It's all about how energy is delivered. Microwaves create intense electromagnetic fields that cause charge to build up on foil's sharp edges, leading to sparks. Conventional ovens, however, use gentle heat, allowing foil to absorb warmth safely without electrical discharge.

Kharge also accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of yielding to Trump's demands regarding Russian oil purchases, citing a film dialogue to illustrate the prime minister's perceived subservience to the US leader.

This move, amidst whispers of her potential elevation, comes as the party seeks to regain ground in Assam.

title: ‘No leniency’: Iran green lights crackdown against ‘rioters’ amid Trump’s warning
description: Iran's judiciary chief vows no leniency for "rioters" despite acknowledging public protest rights amid ongoing economic demonstrations. Protests, fueled by currency devaluation and inflation, have spread across provinces, with authorities distinguishing between protesters and those causing violence. The unrest occurs amidst significant economic pressure and international attention.

Vance's office stated security concerns influence his and the President's co-location.

Aluminium foil use for food: Doctor explains when to be cautious
description: Studies reveal that aluminum foil can leach unsafe levels of metals into food, particularly with acidic, salty, or spicy items cooked at high temperatures. This excess aluminum intake over time may contribute to bone problems, kidney strain, and nerve-related issues. Experts advise using steel, glass, or ceramic containers for storage and avoiding direct contact between foil and certain foods.

title: Ten technology trends to watch in 2026
description: After years of AI hype, 2026 brings a reality check. Companies need to prove their billion-dollar bets are worth it. Data centres are spreading globally, straining power grids. AI agents are moving from pilots to production. Robots are getting smarter. New hardware forms are arriving. Meanwhile, tech billionaires keep getting richer. The gap between hype and deployment is shrinking fast, and 2026 could turn out to be a real pivoting year.

title: Quote of the day Epicurus: “Do not spoil what you have by desiring…”
description: Ancient Greek philosopher Epicurus, founder of "The Garden," advocated for moderation and clear-headedness, not indulgence. He believed true pleasure lies in the absence of pain and worry, achieved by recognizing and being satisfied with life's simpler joys.

title: ‘Human sacrifice’ plot for hidden treasure: 8-month-old rescued from house; couple detained
description: A tip-off to child helpline 1098 averted a suspected child sacrifice in Sulibele, near Bengaluru. Officials rescued an eight-month-old boy from a couple claiming to be his parents, who were allegedly planning a ritual for hidden treasure. The couple, who had illegally adopted the child, denied the allegations, but contradictory statements and a freshly dug pit raised alarm.

title: Delhi blast: Al-Falah University now in pollution dock; hostel project halted
description: Haryana's pollution watchdog has shut down construction at Al-Falah University for violating air quality norms and proceeding without environmental permits. Tests revealed the university's treated wastewater exceeded pollution limits, prompting legal action. The university also failed to register as a bulk waste generator and lacked basic dust control measures during construction.

title: Andrew McCutchen & Maria Hanslovan net worth: MLB earnings, contracts and assets
description: Andrew McCutchen's stellar MLB career, marked by five All-Star selections and an MVP award, has been the bedrock of his substantial finances, amassing over $131 million from contracts. His wife, Maria Hanslovan, contributes significantly through her thriving fitness and wellness career. Together, their combined net worth is estimated between $60-$65 million, bolstered by endorsements and joint assets.

title: Vanessa Bryant says friends pushed her forward long after Kobe’s Lakers legacy
description: Vanessa Bryant, widow of NBA legend Kobe Bryant, continues to champion the Mamba & Mambacita Sports Foundation. Recently, she shared a striking photo, crediting her friends for encouraging her to be more present in pictures.  She also celebrated Taylor Swift wearing Kobe Bryant merchandise, a gesture her daughters, avid Swifties, would appreciate.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly shaken by Travis Kelce’s confession ahead of wedding
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have been dealing with a lot on their plate ever since they announced their engagement last year. While the two have kept themselves busy with planning their wedding, it seems Taylor Swift is deeply unsettled by some of Travis Kelce's words that he has said in public about his past. It seems this has become a huge deal for Taylor Swift ahead of their wedding.

title: AI debate: Mathematician Joel Hamkins warns; ‘LLMs give wrong answers’
description: Renowned mathematician Joel David Hamkins has voiced strong doubts about large language models' utility in mathematical research, calling their outputs "garbage" and "not mathematically correct." He highlights AI's frustrating tendency to confidently assert incorrectness and resist correction, mirroring unproductive human interactions. Despite AI's benchmark successes, Hamkins finds current systems unreliable for genuine research collaboration.
